description: MCP resource definitions exposed by the monocoque-agent-rem server. Resources provide read-only context to connected agents.

slack://channel/{id}/recent.description: Recent chat history from the configured Slack channel. Allows the agent to read operator instructions posted directly in the channel.

id.description: Slack channel ID (e.g., 'C0123456789'). Must match the channel_id configured in config.toml.

limit.description: Maximum number of messages to retrieve

user.description: Slack user ID of the message author

thread_ts.description: Thread timestamp if the message is a reply, null otherwise

has_more.description: Whether more messages are available beyond the limit

slack://channel/{id}/recent.security: Only messages from the configured channel_id are returned. Bot messages included. File uploads represented by text summary only.

monocoque/nudge.description: Server-to-client notification sent when the server detects an agent stall and needs to prompt the agent to resume work. Delivered via CustomNotification on the MCP transport.

session_id.description: Session that triggered the stall alert

message.description: Continuation message (default or custom from operator)

nudge_count.description: How many nudges have been sent for this stall event

idle_seconds.description: How long the agent has been idle

source.description: Whether the nudge was triggered by operator action or auto-escalation

progress_snapshot.description: Progress snapshot from the session at nudge time. Includes summary of completed items and next pending item so the agent can reorient.

slashCommands.description: Slack slash commands handled by the server's command dispatcher. All invoked via /monocoque <command> [args].

help.description: List all available commands, optionally filtered by category

sessions.description: List all tracked sessions with state, timestamps, and last activity

session-start.description: Start a new agent session with the given initial prompt

session-clear.description: Terminate and clean up a session (defaults to active session)

session-checkpoint.description: Create a named checkpoint of the current session state

session-checkpoints.description: List all checkpoints, optionally filtered by session

show-file.description: Display file contents with syntax highlighting
